text: hi everyone is Helen here today I will
be making stuffed bitter melon soup in
Vietnamese is called can whole choir
bitter melon as its name suggests is a
bitter fruit either you love it or hate
it it's an acquired taste so for those
who can enjoy it you will have cravings
every time you think of it in Vietnamese
calm in hardship and why means the past
I don't know why they call it that way
but because of the name we normally make
this soup during the end offerings or
parties or gatherings and to let all the
bitterness and husha be over and wish
for better tomorrow bitter melon is good
for health and skin and it's believed
that the more betrayed is the better is
the treatment if you are new to bitter
melon or has a low level of bitterness
tolerance use the one that are more
shiny and in pale green because the
darker one with sharper teeth are
normally more bitter today I will stuff
the bitter melon with pork so the
sweetness of the pork will balance out
the bitterness of Victor melon so let's
give it a try
depending on the season and where you
live you can buy the bitter melon fresh
or frozen and Asian grocery store frozen
ones are normally cheaper take less time
to cook but of course they don't taste
as good as fresh ones to prepare the
bitter melon trim off the tip and the
stem and cut into three inch lengths use
the handle of a tea spoon to scoop out
the seeds and the fibrous part inside we
only eat the green part for smaller ones
you can make ash last lengthwise to open
remove the fibrous part inside with your
fingers then rinse well and drain
for longer bitter melons it's okay to
have both ends open like this for the
stuffing I'm going to use Ming's pork
you can also use Ming chicken or turkey
some knife fish paste which you can also
buy frozen an Asian store to add more
texture to the stuffing we're going to
use wood ear mushrooms you can buy the
dried black fungus at Asian store and
then soak it in warm water for about 15
minutes to soften also soak some glass
firmly in warm water for about 5 minutes
add the salt in water the mushrooms grow
bigger remove the stem a penny roll them
up and cut into strips then chop finely
you can also use a food processor to
make it faster also roughly chop the
glass noodles in a large mixing bowl
combine the mean spoke knife fish paste
chopped wood ear mushrooms and vermissa
leaves also add some mint shallots or
white pod spring onion then season with
salt sugar and chicken stock and
al-ahzab pepper the knife fish paste
acts at a glue to combine all the
ingredients together well you can also
replace with meat trims or a beaten egg
I use knife fish page because it takes
no time to prepare and it adds a chewy
texture to the feelings mix well and
knead for about 5 minutes so all the
ingredients come together then cover and
set aside for about 15 to 30 minutes
after that stop the meat into the bitter
melon the meat gonna expand when it's
cooked so you don't need to stuff too
tight
for one kilogram of bitter melon you
will need about three liters of water a
salt chicken stock and fish sauce to
your taste stir well to dissolve and
bring to a boil then add the stuffed
with a melon and cook for about 20 to 30
minutes until result occasionally skim
off the form and do not cover the pot to
keep the broth clear transfer to a
serving bowl and garnish with some
coriander
you can quickly blanch a spring onion or
microwave for 30 seconds and tie a bow
around the small bits of melon
so it's look prettier the bitter melon
should be soft enough so that you can
easily pierce through with a chopstick
normally for this soup you will have a
tendency to make more stuffing than
needed in that case this is what you can
do shape the leftover stuffings into
balls and drop into the soup pot or you
can also wrap it in rice paper and then
deep fry to make a crispy spring rolls
just dip the rice paper for just one
second into the warm water and place on
a flat surface then spread the filling
needle to one end and roll it halfway
fold in both sides and continue to rub
until the other end you can also mix
some more shredded carrots or taro into
the fillings so you have more fillings
to work with there you have it killing
two birds with one stone
if you like this recipe don't forget to
click like and subscribe to my channel
for more delicious Vietnamese food thank
you for watching bye bye
